Process.origin: [whoever invents or discovers any new and useful …may obtain a patent therefor " U.S. Code "]

1.definition: a continuous operation, art, or method esp. in manufacture [whoever invents or discovers any new and useful …may obtain a patent therefor ""]

sub_terms.b: a means (as a summons) used to compel a defendant to appear in courta means by which a court acquires or exercises jurisdiction over a person or property see alsocompare,

2 a.note: In civil procedure, service of a summons on a defendant is considered constitutionally sufficient process, although usually a copy of the complaint must also be provided according to the local rule of procedure.
